copyright_text: 2022 PMD First Aid & CPR. All rights reserved.
pop_courses_section_text: Our clients spoke and we listened. Here are their favourite courses of 2022.
pop_course_1_text: A comprehensive two-day course offering first aid and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) skills for those who need training due to work requirements or who want more knowledge to respond to emergencies at home...
pop_course_2_text: A basic one-day course offering lifesaving first aid and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) skills for the workplace or home...
pop_course_3_text: Courses on cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) provide the skills needed to recognize and respond to cardiovascular emergencies and choking for adults, children, and babies depending on the level of CPR chosen...
pop_course_4_text: Designed to build participant confidence in performing cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) skills in a team environment for professionals with a duty to respond...
authorizations_section_text: PMD First Aid & CPR is a proud and authorized First Aid/CPR training partner of the Canadian Red Cross. Through this partnership, PMD is fully recognized by the WSIB under the red cross.
about_us_text_1: As the founder of PMD First Aid & CPR Paul has been a Bilingual Certified Instructor and a Teaching Experience Supervisor with the Canadian Red Cross since 1993. He is also a graduate of Laurentian University with an Honours Bachelor of Physical and Health Education as well as a Certified Exercise Physiologist. Paul has over 11 years of Adult Education knowledge which he uses to provide learners with strategies to increase skill retention and application.
about_us_text_2_item_1: High quality bilingual training – French and English
about_us_text_2_item_2: Flexible scheduling and tailored to the learner
about_us_text_2_item_3: Red Cross Certification valid for 3 years
about_us_mission_text: Community driven and proud to offer First Aid and CPR courses in Canada’s official languages - French and English. We meet people at their level and excel in providing knowledge and confidence.
about_us_vision_text: Making First Aid and CPR accessible to all. To inspire learners to gain first-hand knowledge and confidence and to be able to help others with a compassionate lens.
about_us_values_text: As a key operating principle, PMD First Aid and CPR provides a safe and welcoming space to learn. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all of our courses while building a psychologically safe learning environment.
courses_subtitle_1: What is a blended learning first aid course?
courses_text_1: Blended learning is a combination of in-class, face-to-face instruction with online instruction. Typically, theory and information are conveyed to participants outside of the classroom through an online component. This allows for the in-class component to concentrate on skill development and the application of theory.
courses_text_2_item_1: Better information retention and ease of review
courses_text_2_item_2: Enables students to learn at their own pace
testimonials_text_1: Your feedback gives us the unique opportunity to further enhance our courses in their content and delivery. Here, you can see some of the feeback we have received from our clients.
testimonials_sample_text_1: Be one of the first to share your experience with PMD!
contact_us_text_1: We’d love to hear from you! Send us a message using the form below and include any business inquiries or requests you may have.
course_info_sfa_summary: A comprehensive two-day course offering first aid and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) skills for those who need training due to work requirements or who want more knowledge to respond to emergencies at home. Course meets legislation requirements for provincial/territorial worker safety and insurance boards and includes the latest first aid and CPR guidelines.
course_info_sfa_content_7: First aid for respiratory and cardiac arrest
course_info_sfa_content_14: Includes any other content required by specific legislation
course_info_sfa_materials_2: Comprehensive Guide to First Aid & CPR (eBook)
course_info_sfa_materials_3: Standard First Aid CPR A/C – Online access
course_info_sfa_materials_4: Standard First Aid certificate (digital certificate issued upon successful completion)
course_info_sfa_duration_1: CPR A: 13 hours in-class OR 5.5 hours in-class + 8 hours online learning
course_info_sfa_duration_2: CPR C: 14 hours in-class OR 7.5 hours in-class + 8 hours online learning
course_info_sfa_completion_1: Successfully demonstrate skills and critical steps
course_info_sfa_completion_2: Min. 75% mark for written knowledge evaluation
course_info_sfa_completion_3: Attend and participate in 100% of the course
course_info_sfa_certification_1: 3-year certification in Standard First Aid and CPR Level A or C
course_info_sfa_recertification_1: CPR A: 6.5 hours in-class OR 3 hours in-class + 4 hours online learning
course_info_sfa_recertification_2: CPR C: 7.5 hours in-class OR 4 hours in-class + 4 hours online learning
course_info_efa_summary: A basic one-day course offering lifesaving first aid and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) skills for the workplace or home. Course meets legislation requirements for provincial/territorial worker safety and insurance boards and includes the latest first aid and CPR guidelines.
course_info_efa_content_7: First aid for respiratory and cardiac arrest
course_info_efa_content_9: Includes any other content required by specific legislation
course_info_efa_materials_2: Comprehensive Guide to First Aid & CPR (eBook)
course_info_efa_materials_4: Emergency First Aid certificate (digital certificate issued upon successful completion)
course_info_efa_duration_1: CPR A: 6.5 hours in-class OR 3.5 hours in-class + 4 hours online learning
course_info_efa_duration_2: CPR C: 7.5 hours in-class OR 4.5 hours in-class + 4 hours online learning
course_info_efa_completion_1: Successfully demonstrate skills and critical steps
course_info_efa_completion_2: Min. 75% mark for written knowledge evaluation
course_info_efa_completion_3: Attend and participate in 100% of the course
course_info_efa_certification_1: 3-year certification in Emergency First Aid and CPR Level A or C
course_info_efa_recertification_1: CPR A: 4 hours in-class OR 3 hours in-class + 4 hours online learning
course_info_efa_recertification_2: CPR C: 5 hours in-class OR 4 hours in-class + 4 hours online learning
course_info_cpraed_summary: Courses on cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) provide the skills needed to recognize and respond to cardiovascular emergencies and choking for adults, children, and babies depending on the level of CPR chosen. Courses meet legislation requirements for provincial/territorial worker safety and insurance boards, and include the latest CPR guidelines and training in the use of an automated external defibrillator (AED).
course_info_cpraed_content_15: CPR and AED – child and baby
course_info_cpraed_content_16: Includes any other content required by specific legislation
course_info_cpraed_materials_2: Comprehensive Guide to First Aid & CPR (eBook)
course_info_cpraed_materials_4: CPR certificate (digital certificate issued upon successful completion)
course_info_cpraed_duration_1: CPR A: 4 hours in-class OR 2 hours in-class + 3 hours online learning
course_info_cpraed_duration_2: CPR C: 5 hours in-class OR 3 hours in-class + 3 hours online learning
course_info_cpraed_instructor_1: CPR Instructor or First Aid Instructor
course_info_cpraed_completion_1: Successfully demonstrate skills and critical steps
course_info_cpraed_completion_2: Min. 75% mark for written knowledge evaluation
course_info_cpraed_completion_3: Attend and participate in 100% of the course
course_info_cpraed_certification_1: 3-year certification in CPR Level A or C
course_info_cpraed_recertification_1: Recertification of CPR A is not available
course_info_cpraed_recertification_2: Recertification for CPR C is 3.5 hours teaching time in-class OR 2 hours online learning + 2.5 hours in-class for Blended CPR
course_info_bls_summary: Designed to build participant confidence in performing cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) skills in a team environment for professionals with a duty to respond. Teaches the important steps to perform a rapid assessment, perform Basic Life Support (BLS) skills, and perform rapid defibrillation including use of an Automated External Defibrillator (AED). Airway Management and Oxygen Therapy can also be added as additional certifications to this course.
course_info_bls_content_3: Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) and Automated External Defibrillator (AED)
course_info_bls_materials_1: Canadian Red Cross Basic Life Support Field Guide
course_info_bls_duration_4: With Airway Management and Oxygen Therapy – 6 hours
course_info_bls_instructor_1: CPR Instructor or First Aid Instructor
course_info_bls_completion_1: Successfully demonstrate all course skill competencies
course_info_bls_completion_2: Minimum 75% mark for written, closed book, knowledge evaluation
course_info_bls_completion_3: Attend and participate in 100% of the course
course_info_bls_certification_1: 1-year certification in Basic Life Support (digital certificate issued upon successful completion)
course_info_mbfa_summary: Comprehensive two-day course designed to meet the needs of those expected to provide first aid in a marine environment. Course uses a combination of lecture, discussion, and scenarios taken from the marine/fishing industry to teach the required knowledge and skills. Course meets the requirements of Transport Canada outlined in Transport Publication (TP) 13008 E.
course_info_mbfa_content_7: First aid for respiratory and cardiac arrest - adult
course_info_mbfa_materials_2: Comprehensive Guide to First Aid & CPR (eBook)
course_info_mbfa_materials_3: Marine Basic First Aid certificate (digital certificate issued upon successful completion)
course_info_mbfa_materials_4: Transport Canada certification issued directly by CRC
course_info_mbfa_prerequisite_2: A student does not require a CDN in order to participate in a MBFA course
course_info_mbfa_completion_1: Successfully demonstrate skills and critical steps
course_info_mbfa_completion_2: Min. 75% mark for written knowledge evaluation
course_info_mbfa_completion_3: Attend and participate in 100% of the course
course_info_mbfa_certification_1: 3-year certification in Marine Basic First Aid and CPR/ AED Level A
course_info_mbfa_recertification_1: Recertification of Marine First Aid is not permitted under federal regulations
course_info_sfacc_summary: Comprehensive two-day course offering lifesaving first aid skills, cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) skills, and injury prevention skills and knowledge, with a focus on childhood injuries and illnesses. Includes the latest first aid and CPR guidelines and meets legislation requirements for provincial/ territorial early childhood education and day care worker safety requirements. Check local legislation to determine certification level, maintenance, and recertification requirements.
course_info_sfacc_content_6: Breathing and Circulation emergencies - child and baby
course_info_sfacc_content_7: First aid for respiratory and cardiac arrest – child and baby
course_info_sfacc_content_16: Includes any other content required by specific legislation
course_info_sfacc_materials_1: Child Care First Aid (print and/or eBook)
course_info_sfacc_materials_2: Comprehensive Guide to First Aid & CPR (eBook)
course_info_sfacc_materials_3: First Aid certificate - Standard Child Care (digital certificate issued upon successful completion)
course_info_sfacc_completion_1: Successfully demonstrate skills and critical steps
course_info_sfacc_completion_2: Min. 75% mark for written knowledge evaluation
course_info_sfacc_completion_3: Attend and participate in 100% of the course
course_info_sfacc_certification_1: 3-year certification in Standard Child Care First Aid
course_info_efacc_summary: Basic one-day course designed to introduce caregivers to injury prevention skills and knowledge. Course covers lifesaving first aid skills and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR and AED) for children, and babies. Course meets legislation requirements for provincial/territorial early childhood education and day care worker safety requirements. Check local legislation to determine certification level, maintenance, and recertification requirements.
course_info_efacc_content_6: Breathing and Circulation emergencies – Child and baby
course_info_efacc_content_7: First aid for respiratory and cardiac arrest – Child and baby
course_info_efacc_content_15: Includes any other content required by specific legislation

course_info_efacc_materials_2: Comprehensive Guide to First Aid & CPR (eBook)

course_info_efacc_completion_2: Min. 75% mark for written knowledge evaluation
course_info_efacc_completion_3: Attend and participate in 100% of the course
course_info_efacc_certification_1: 3-year certification in Emergency Child Care First Aid
course_info_ot_summary: Designed to provide participants with the knowledge and skills to correctly identify when it is necessary to administer supplemental oxygen. Participants will learn how to properly and safely handle and assemble the equipment and how to correctly deliver supplemental oxygen through the appropriate delivery device. Course can also be combined with Basic Life Support.
course_info_ot_materials_1: Canadian Red Cross Basic Life Support Field Guide
course_info_ot_instructor_1: CPR Instructor or First Aid Instructor
course_info_ot_completion_1: Successfully demonstrate all course skill competencies
course_info_ot_completion_2: Minimum 75% mark for written, closed book, knowledge evaluation
course_info_ot_completion_3: Attend and participate in 100% of the course
course_info_ot_certification_1: 3-year certification in Oxygen Therapy (digital certificate issued upon successful completion)
course_info_ot_recertification_1: No recertification available for this course
course_info_am_summary: Designed to provide participants with the knowledge and skills to create a patent airway, the interventions to maintain it, and the equipment available to carry out these skills. Participants will gain the knowledge and skills required to provide the appropriate interventions, including measuring and inserting the applicable airway adjunct based on the patient’s condition. Course can also be combined with Basic Life Support training for additional certification.
course_info_am_materials_1: Canadian Red Cross Basic Life Support Field Guide
course_info_am_duration_2: 1 hour when combined with Basic Life Support
course_info_am_instructor_1: CPR Instructor or First Aid Instructor
course_info_am_completion_1: Successfully demonstrate all course skill competencies
course_info_am_completion_2: Minimum 75% mark for written, closed book, knowledge evaluation
course_info_am_completion_3: Attend and participate in 100% of the course
course_info_am_certification_1: 3-year certification in Standard First Aid and CPR 3-year certification in Airway Management (digital certificate issued upon successful completion) Level A or C
course_info_am_recertification_1: No recertification available for this course
